room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Indianapolis in Indianapolis
review: We had a great time. In town on vacation.We did "runaway train". It was a lot of fun, clever game, interesting clues and interesting logic problems, nicely decorated.Amelia was our game master and did a great job. Our best game master yet (we've done about nine escape games across the country).We'll do Breakout rooms again.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Indianapolis in Indianapolis
review: We were visiting Indy with our 2 teen daughters and some young adult family. We all had a LOT of fun doing 3 escape rooms at Breakout. The Runaway Train was super fantastic, and Island Escape and Mystery Mansion were great too. We broke out of all rooms with some hints. It was great fun for all.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Indianapolis in Indianapolis
review: We went to Breakout as a guift for my son's 32nd birthday. What an awesome time. We did the runaway train and it weas a great exercise in group problem solving. Can't wait to go back and try another senario. I could see this being a perfect team building activity for co-workers.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Indianapolis in Indianapolis
review: My group and I played runaway train a few weeks ago. I think out of all the escape rooms I have played. Train is my favorite. Charity was awesome. We had fun playing with her.

room_title: Escape room "Runaway Train" by Breakout Games - Indianapolis in Indianapolis
review: Entertaining and challenging. This is a perfect venue for a couple, a family, a corporate event, etc.We did the runaway train challenge and it was our first time ever in an escape room. There's something to be said for experience - some aspects require less examination and some require more. Going thru a room once will give you a much better idea of which aspects fall into which bucket.Staff will chime in on the speaker if/when they see you doing something that's obviously wrong or if they see you struggling. You will need these "Big Brother" guides, hints, or whatever you want to call them.
